page.title: 06A gamekeeper's work.
page.content: Depending on the time of year a gamekeeper usually starts work very early in the morning. The job that Mr. Calder likes best is{shooting;} especially at the beginning of September. He shoots about 30 or 40 deer a year, sometimes less. These are mostly Roe Deer. The meat is sold to the game dealer and the heads are sometimes mounted and given to the people who shoot them. Mr. Calder works on 6 \ thousand acres. Half of this is hill and the other half is low ground for shooting pheasants.He doesn't have any bother with poachers except for hill lochs and river {poaching}for salmon or trout.Now and then he is bothered with buzzards and eagles which try to take the pheasant chicks.He rears over 1000{pheasants each year.Altogether he has a very interesting life.{
